title: ISic003553. An antiquarian 'forgery'
body:
Facsimile Images

κε͂τε ((·)) ἐνθάδε [...]
ἄμεμπτε καὶ [..]
πυνε[..] Ἁδριανα [...]
ἀνδρὶ εὐσεβ[εῖ].

Apparatus criticus

Text after Kaibel and Filippi with supplements/restorations of SEG, prioritising Kaibel's transcription of the manuscript tradition.

translation

commentary

As Korhonen lucidly details, the inscription is one of a series of late 18th century local antiquarian forgeries, constructed on the basis of existing texts, principally those to be found in the 1769 first edition of the corpus of Torremuzza. Kaibel classed the entire series already as forgeries in IG XIV.

bibliography

  • 14.0020* https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 52.0898 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Filippi 2002 74 no. 4/13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001991
  • Filippi 2005 65 no./13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002296
  • Korhonen 2017 198 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001484
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
